title: Bastion Square
text:
Bastion Square is a historic <a href="Pedestrian%20zone">pedestrian mall</a> in <a href="Victoria%2C%20British%20Columbia">Victoria, British Columbia</a>.
The square has a ceremonial entry <a href="arch">arch</a> at View and <a href="Government%20Street%20%28Victoria%2C%20British%20Columbia%29">Government</a> streets, and the exit on the Wharf Street side opens to a staircase with a view of the <a href="Victoria%20Harbour%20%28British%20Columbia%29%23Inner%20Harbour">Inner Harbour</a>.
In 1963, under the direction of city planner Rod Clack, Bastion Square was developed as part of the modern scheme for <a href="Centennial%20Square">Centennial Square</a>. View Street was closed off, and a pedestrian area was created, set off by restored historic buildings on three sides and a view across the harbour on the fourth.
Historic buildings on the square include Burnes House, the Beaver Building, the <a href="Board%20of%20Trade%20Building%20%28Victoria%2C%20British%20Columbia%29">Board of Trade Building</a>, Chancery Chambers, Law Chambers, the Rithet Building, and the Supreme Court Building.
Events held at the square include the Bastion Square <a href="Marketplace">Public Market</a>, the Holiday Market, and the Art Walk.
